title: Shari'ah law in both Nigeria and Iran

content.prompt: Which of the following statements is true with regard to the judicial systems in Nigeria and Iran?

choices.label: Both systems reflect the British influence in following both codified and common law.
Both systems are reflective of the Napoleonic influence and have only codified law.
Both systems have elements of Shari’ah law incorporated into their judicial systems.
Both systems reject the concept of human rights being protected by a constitution.
Both systems forbid the use of lawyers to argue cases against the government’s charges in criminal cases.

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Compare two or more course countries based on their political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
